sentences.english: The pressure on his ear-drums was a pain, and there was a buzzing in his head.
sentences.chinese: 耳膜上的壓力使他疼痛，頭也嗡嗡地響了起來。

sentences.english: His eardrum was broken in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 在事故中他的耳膜破了。

sentences.english: One of the officers said the sound of the blast was so loud his eardrums burst.
sentences.chinese: 一名軍官說，巨大的爆炸聲造成了他的耳膜破裂。

sentences.english: He suffered a perforated eardrum after being beaten and is now partially deaf.
sentences.chinese: 他在被毒打之後導致耳膜穿孔，目前已經半聾。

sentences.english: Damage to eardrums can be expected when overpressures reach 720 pounds.
sentences.chinese: 當超壓達到720磅的時候，可能會造成耳膜損傷。

sentences.english: Damage to eardrums can be expected when overpressures reach 720 pounds.
sentences.chinese: 當超壓達到720磅的時候，可能會造成耳膜損傷。

sentences.english: Never try irrigation if the eardrop eardrum is borkenbroken.
sentences.chinese: 若是耳膜有破裂，千萬別嘗試耳道灌洗。

sentences.english: Perforated eardrums can predispose the ear to infection or result in hearing loss.
sentences.chinese: 耳膜穿孔使耳部易於感染或導致聽力喪失。

sentences.english: Then I have the OPS . to my left ear immediately(adopt conservative treat to my right ear).
sentences.chinese: 於是立即對左耳進行耳膜穿刺手術。

sentences.english: Distant but clear Longyin instigating the eardrums of every person.
sentences.chinese: 遙遠卻清晰的龍吟鼓動着每一個人的耳膜。

definition: loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
